meanings.definition: To dive before or ahead of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The eager swimmer decided to predive into the pool before his friends.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to predive into the water before anyone else during swimming practice.
meanings.sent3: The dolphin thought it would be funny to predive in front of the seal, surprising it.
meanings.sent4: The bird seemed to predive through the air, swooping down gracefully to catch its prey.
meanings.sent5: The idea of predive made the synchronized swimmers stand out in their routine.

meanings.sent1: The predive stretching exercises helped the diver warm up before the competition.
meanings.sent2: The coach emphasized the importance of predive preparation to avoid injuries.
meanings.sent3: The predive snack of a banana gave the diver a boost of energy before the big event.
meanings.sent4: The predive nerves made the diver feel both excited and anxious at the same time.
meanings.sent5: The predive checklist ensured that all equipment was ready for the upcoming dive.

meanings.definition: A dive that is done before another dive.
meanings.sent1: The synchronized team executed a perfect predive before their main routine.
meanings.sent2: The judges were impressed by the synchronization of the predive performed by the divers.
meanings.sent3: The predive became the highlight of the show, setting the tone for the rest of the performance.
meanings.sent4: The predive symbolized the unity and precision of the diving team.
meanings.sent5: The audience held their breath as they watched the predive unfold with grace and skill.
